H0.text: Liquid and solid states differentiate oils and fats at room temperature, with oils being liquid and fats being solid.

H1.text: Solid and gas states are the difference between oils and fats at room temperature.

H2.text: Saturated and unsaturated are the differences between oils and fats at room temperature.

H3.text: Liquid and gas states are the difference between oils and fats at room temperature.

A4.text: The term often refers specifically to triglycerides that are solid or semisolid at room temperature, thus excluding oils.

A5.text: The term may also be used more broadly as a synonym of lipidâ€”any substance of biological relevance... insoluble in water but soluble in non-polar solvents.
